business.headline: Sensex closes 322 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 322.39 points to close at 85,439.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 78.25 points to end at 26,250.30.

What worries RBI about India's insurance sector despite its stability?The RBI highlights that the insurance sector is systemically important because of its size, its role as a long-term investor, and its growing links with the wider financial system.

How investors can manage short-term uncertainty with digital gold, ETFs and SGBsFrom an investment perspective, buying physical gold may no longer be the most efficient choice. When purchasing physical gold, investors must pay 3% GST upfront, which immediately impacts returns.

Gold prices rise again as US–Venezuela tensions flare. Buy now or wait?Market participants say the latest geopolitical flare-up has reinforced gold's role as a hedge against uncertainty, at a time when investors are already navigating an uneasy global backdrop.

Mis-selling complaints are rising. Here's what IRDAI's latest report showsData in the IRDAI Annual Report 2024–25 shows that grievances categorised under Unfair Business Practices increased to 26,667 in FY25, up from 23,335 in FY24, a rise of around 14% year-on-year.

US action on Venezuela's oil: Is there an opportunity for India?Indian oil refiners and upstream companies could still find opportunities if Venezuelan crude re-enters global markets and long-pending investments and payments are unlocked.

Cupid share price tumbles nearly 20%. Why is it falling today?Cupid shares have now fallen nearly 30% over the past five trading sessions, wiping out a significant portion of the gains made during a recent sharp rally.

Petrodollar power play: How oil dollars connect to the US attack on VenezuelaWhile Washington has cited narcoterrorism charges and security concerns, questions are being raised over whether Venezuela's vast oil reserves and its efforts to trade oil outside the US dollar system played a role.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks see decline in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 68.48 points to 85,693.53, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.35 points to 26,313.20 as of 9:23 am.

Unhappy with pace of change, Tata Group looks to replace Air India CEO: ReportGroup chairman N Chandrasekaran has spoken with chief executives of at least two large airlines based in the UK and the US.

Venezuela cuts crude output as US oil blockade chokes storageCaracas is in political crisis under an interim government after President Nicolas Maduro and his wife were captured by US forces on Saturday. The OPEC country's oil exports, its main source of revenue, are now at a standstill following a US blockade on tankers under sanctions and the seizure of two oil cargoes last month.

US control of Venezuelan oil could unlock $1 billion in dues for India, lift outputA US-led takeover or restructuring of Venezuela's oil sector could help India recover nearly $1 billion in long-pending dues and revive crude production from fields operated by ONGC Videsh, analysts and industry sources said.

Inside the gig economy: The real cost of your 10-minute deliveriesTen-minute deliveries have become part of everyday life in urban India. What makes that speed possible is rarely part of the conversation. Read on to understand the people, platforms and policies behind it.

Why salaried Indians need a personal finance reset in 2026Rising living costs, changing job patterns and sweeping labour law reforms are urging salaried Indians to rethink how secure their finances really are.

Ban gig work and you don't solve inequality: Eternal CEO Deepinder GoyalEternal founder Deepinder Goyal argued that the gig economy debate is less about wages and more about discomfort with inequality, warning that bans and over-regulation could erase livelihoods instead of fixing systemic gaps.
Sensex closes 573 points higher, Nifty hits fresh high; NTPC up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 573.41 points to close at 85,762.01, while the Nifty50 jumped 182 points to end at 26,328.55​​​​​​​.

Cigarettes to cost more from February 1. Here's how new rates will be decidedThe new levies on tobacco and pan masala will be imposed over and above the applicable GST rates. These measures will replace the GST compensation cess, which is currently charged at varying rates on sin products.

Missed the revised ITR filing deadline? Know what happens to tax refundIn most cases, refunds are issued within a few weeks to a few months. Delays may occur due to mismatches in TDS details, bank account validation issues, or cases selected for scrutiny.

ITC shares tumble 4%, down 13% in 2 days: Buy the dip or stay away?The sharp sell-off comes after the finance ministry revised the taxation structure for cigarettes, effective February 1, 2026. Here is all you need to know.

MCX shares crash 80% in early deals, but the fall is not what it seemsMCX shares fell by more than 80% on trading screens on Friday, hitting an intraday low of Rs 2,192 on the BSE. This was compared with Thursday's closing price of Rs 10,988.60.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Yash's Toxic teaser to release on actor's 40th birthday The teaser for Toxic will be unveiled on Yash's 40th birthday, creating a special moment for fans. The film promises a bold, intense portrayal of Yash with a global gangster drama appeal.

Salman Khan eyes film with The Family Man's Raj & DK after Battle of Galwan: Report Discussions are underway between Salman Khan and filmmaker duo Raj & DK for a possible collaboration on an action-comedy, with the project currently at an early stage. Meanwhile, Khan is occupied with his upcoming film Battle Of Galwan.

Asha Parekh with her favourites Waheeda Rehman, Helen: Friendship goal unlocked Veteran Bollywood actors Asha Parekh, Waheeda Rehman and Helen were seen enjoying a rare dinner outing together in Mumbai.

Can Love be Translated? promises bonds beyond language barrier. Watch trailer The upcoming series Can This Love Be Translated? will premiere on January 16, bringing together Kim Seon-ho and Go Youn-jung in a global journey of communication and emotion.

Jana Nayagan trailer is on fire, says Rishab Shetty as he wishes Vijay and team Kannada actor Rishab Shetty has shared his enthusiastic response to the trailer of Jana Nayagan, offering his best wishes to Thalapathy Vijay and the film's team ahead of its January 9 release.

Ikkis box office day 4: Amitabh says 'way to go' as Agastya's film sees uptick Amitabh Bachchan celebrated his grandson Agastya Nanda's box office success with Ikkis. The film has collected Rs 22.05 crore despite strong competition from Dhurandhar.

Happy Patel Khatarnak Jasoos: Check out Vir Das, Mithila Palkar's duet Chaanta Tera The romantic song Chaanta Tera from Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos was released on January 5, 2025. The quirky track features Vir Das and Mithila Palkar.

Hema Malini on bond with Sunny, Bobby after Dharmendra's death: This is personal Hema Malini addressed rumours surrounding separate prayer meetings held after Dharmendra's death, clarifying that the decision was personal and not a sign of differences within the family.

Yami Gautam-Aditya Dhar pray at ancient Maa Baglamukhi temple in Himachal's Kangra Yami Gautam-Aditya Dhar prayed at the ancient Maa Baglamukhi temple in Kangra, Himachal Pradesh. Aditya recently directed the espionage-thriller 'Dhurandhar', featuring Ranveer Singh in the lead role.

Timothee Chalamet's Critics Choice win boosts India release of Marty Supreme Marty Supreme, starring Timothee Chalamet and directed by Josh Safdie, has emerged as a leading contender this awards season after winning the Best Actor award at the Critics Choice Awards 2026. The film, which explores ambition and perseverance in New York's underground, is set for release in Indian cinemas in January.

Jana Nayagan and Parasakthi: Pending censor certificate delay Tamil Nadu bookings Advance bookings for Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan and Sivakarthikeyan's Parasakthi remain stalled in Tamil Nadu as the film awaits its Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) certificate, leading to growing uncertainty among theatres and moviegoers.

AI Logo gone, backlash still on: Vijay's Jana Nayagan trailer faces meme storm The trailer of Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan came under fire after viewers spotted a Google Gemini logo in a fleeting frame, triggering backlash online.

Jiya Shankar's team denies publicity stunts amid mystery man photo speculation Jiya Shankar's team has issued a statement in response to speculation over a photo featuring a mystery man, emphasising the actor's wish for privacy and her avoidance of publicity stunts.

Deepika Padukone launches initiative to empower creative talent on 40th birthday Deepika Padukone launched an initiative to empower creative talent. She launched her platform for aspirants across the film, television and advertising industry on January 5, 2026, which marks her 40th birthday.

Stop making it dirty: Mahhi Vij's message after separation with Jay Bhanushali Mahhi Vij has responded to media speculation following her separation from Jay Bhanushali, emphasising the couple's commitment to their children.

Explained: Dashavatar in Oscars contention list vs Homebound as official nominee Marathi film Dashavatar has entered the Oscar contention list, marking a major moment for regional cinema. Here's what the contention list means and how it differs from final Oscar nominations.

Kakashi Hatake: Sad ninja who still slays and leads like a legend In this week's Animania, we discover Kakashi Hatake's tragic past, his losses, and how he became one of Naruto's most powerful and respected ninjas.

Hacks stars cheekily recreate Timothee Chalamet and Kylie Jenner's look Actors Meg Stalter and Paul W. Downs recreated the notable red carpet look of Timothee Chalamet and Kylie Jenner at the 2026 Critics Choice Awards, drawing attention with their precise homage.

Vikrant Massey's intimate new year celebration with wife Sheetal and son Vardaan Vikrant Massey rang in 2026 with a quiet and intimate family getaway, as wife Sheetal Thakur shared heartwarming moments from their New Year celebrations on Instagram.

general news.headline: This is life now: Umar Khalid to partner after Supreme Court denies bailAb yahi zindagi hai: Umar Khalid's partner reveals what he said after Supreme Court denied him bail

Indian who fled US after murdering Telugu ex-girlfriend arrested in Tamil NaduAn international manhunt concluded in Tamil Nadu with the arrest of Arjun Sharma, accused of murdering Telugu woman Nikita Godishala in the US and fleeing to India.

Delhi shocker: Goons assault, strip father-son duo, chilling video surfacesThe entire incident was captured on CCTV camera which showed the goons dragging, assaulting the duo before stripping the son naked.

Cricketer Mohammed Shami, brother summoned for SIR hearing in KolkataAccording to Election Commission sources, the names of Shami and his brother surfaced on the hearing list owing to complications in their enumeration forms. The issues relate to discrepancies in progeny mapping and self-mapping.

Trump alerted oil giants before Venezuela strike, Congress kept in darkDonald Trump said he spoke to oil giants before and after the US strikes on Venezuela as Congress claimed that it received no prior information or briefing. American lawmakers were only informed after the mission was over.

Kailash Vijayvargiya's 'ghanta' remark makes it to govt record, official suspendedA government order in Madhya Pradesh citing a controversial remark by Cabinet Minister Kailash Vijayvargiya has led to the suspension of a senior officer and his assistant, sparking administrative upheaval.

Gas leak, fire scare at ONGC oil well triggers panic, evacuation in Andhra villagePanic broke out in Ambedkar Konaseema district in Andhra Pradesh after a suspected gas leak from an operational ONGC oil well. Residents were evacuated as gas reportedly spread into homes. Officials are assessing the situation.

Bangladesh orders indefinite ban on IPL telecast after Mustafizur Rahman rowThe Bangladesh government has imposed an indefinite ban on the telecast and promotion of the Indian Premier League (IPL) in response to the controversy over the removal of national fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman from the Kolkata Knight Riders squad.

Viral photo of Nicolas Maduro's capture turns into a windfall for NikeHours after the capture, President Donald Trump shared a photo of Maduro handcuffed and blindfolded, dressed in a gray Nike Tech tracksuit, that has since sold out in 3XL size following the image going viral.

Trump aide claims Indian envoy sought tariff relief; Congress alleges selloutSpeaking to reporters aboard Air Force One alongside US President Donald Trump, US Senator Lindsey Graham said that during a meeting at the Indian Ambassador's residence last month, the focus was entirely on India cutting back its Russian oil imports. According to Graham, India's Ambassador to the United States requested that he convey this message to President Trump and ask for relief from the 25 per cent tariff imposed on Indian goods.

Manchester United reluctantly sack Ruben Amorim, offer bizarre explanationManchester United have reportedly sacked Ruben Amorim following the fallout with the club's board in recent days. Amorim's last game in charge came against Leeds United on Sunday, January 4.

New Make in India record? Apple ships iPhones worth $50bn from IndiaApple surpassed iPhone exports worth $50 billion in 2025 from India to global markets, as confirmed by the Union Minister of Electronics and Information Technology, Ashwini Vaishnav, on X. The Cupertino giant is one of the largest companies part of the Government of India's smartphone production linked initiative (PLI) scheme.

Why oil-rich Venezuela pumps under 1% of global crude and can Trump push it?Venezuela holds nearly 20% of the world's proven oil reserves, but pumps less than a percent of global crude. After capturing its leader, Trump is now promising that US companies will revive production. Can he unlock the world's largest oil reserves?

PM Modi knew I wasn't happy: Trump hints at new tariffs over Russian oilAddressing reporters on board Air Force One on Sunday, Trump said, "PM Modi's a very good man. He's a good guy. He knew I was not happy. It was important to make me happy. They do trade, and we can raise tariffs on them very quickly."

No bail for Umar Khalid, Sharjeel Imam in Delhi riots case; 5 others get reliefDenying bail to Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, the Supreme Court said national security and public order trump prolonged pre-trial custody. The bench, however, granted bail to Gulfisha Fatima, Meeran Haider, Shifa Ur Rehman, Mohd Saleem Khan and Shadab Ahmed.

5,000 km in 5 days: Tiny Amur falcons from India aced physics to flyThey flew to Africa in late 2025 as conservationists monitored their movement using satellites and tracked their cross-continent journey.

Indian man beaten in Thailand by trans women over alleged non-payment for 'service'An Indian man was assaulted by trans women sex workers in Thailand over unpaid fees for services. The viral incident has sparked debate on tourist safety and ongoing investigations.

What is the device on Deepinder Goyal's temple? Brain-monitor wearable explainedZomato founder Deepinder Goyal appeared on a popular podcast wearing an unusual brain-monitoring wearable called Temple, sparking online buzz and memes as he explains how it tracks cerebral blood flow.

INSV Kaundinya crew switch to thepla, pickle as supplies run out halfway throughAbout a week into its maiden voyage from Porbandar to Muscat, the Indian Navy's stitched sailing vessel INSV Kaundinya is nearing the halfway mark. Onboard, PM Narendra Modi's advisor Sanjeev Sanyal said early weather slowed progress, but the ship is now back on course. Fresh rations have run out, and the crew has now switched to Gujarati staple, thepla.
Labubu who? Japan's Mirumi could be 2026's new viral obsessionMove over, Labubu. 2026's new obsession could be Mirumi, the cute little bot charm.

This roadside stop became famous for just one dishThere's a certain stretch where both sides of the road line up with sweet shops stacked back-to-back, each promising the same thing: Langcha. This is Shaktigarh, or what most travellers now simply recognise as the place to stop for this delectable sweet.

US strikes on Venezuela is Trump doctrine of control of Western Hemisphere in action Trump Corollary reasserts US dominance in the Western Hemisphere via aggressive interventions like Maduro's January 2026 capture in Venezuela. Should his other threats be taken seriously?

Andhra engineer, wife killed in car crash in US, had visited India days agoA Telugu software engineer and his wife from Palakollu died in a road accident in Washington, US. Their two children were injured and are undergoing treatment.

Government-backed Bharat Taxi adds 45,000 users daily, big nationwide launch teasedGovernment-backed Bharat Taxi is seeing rapid early traction, adding up to 45,000 users daily as it prepares for a larger nationwide rollout.

sports.headline: Manchester United reluctantly sack Ruben Amorim, offer bizarre explanation Manchester United have reportedly sacked Ruben Amorim following the fallout with the club's board in recent days. Amorim's last game in charge came against Leeds United on Sunday, January 4.

On the chopping block: The brewing power struggle over Manpreet Singh's future A power struggle within Hockey India threatens Manpreet Singh's future, with selectors and coaches at odds as his 411-cap tally nears governing body president Dilip Tirkey's record. Will the 33-year-old remain part of the plans in a busy year that includes the World Cup in August?

Jemimah Rodrigues should be India's next captain: Marizanne Kapp backs DC skipper Marizanne Kapp believes Jemimah Rodrigues has the leadership qualities to succeed Harmanpreet Kaur as India's next captain after being named Delhi Capitals' skipper for Women's Premier League 2026.

Fit-again Shreyas Iyer to captain Mumbai before New Zealand ODI series Shreyas Iyer will captain Mumbai in their Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Himachal Pradesh in Jaipur on Tuesday. The fixture marks the Punjab Kings captain's return to competitive cricket following his recovery from a spleen injury.

Sumit Nagal begins 2026 with new tennis academy in Chandigarh Sumit Nagal opens his 2026 season with a fresh off-court reset by joining Roundglass Sports. As results fluctuate, the partnership signals renewed focus on structure, stability and a strong return to form.

Root defends England teammate's abysmal dismissal: Can't win games by surviving Ashes: England batter Joe Root has defended teammate Jamie Smith after the wicketkeeper was criticised for his dismissal during the New Year's Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

Kapil Dev on Bangladesh players' participation in Golf Tour: No decision yet PGTI President Kapil Dev said no decision has yet been made on allowing Bangladeshi golfers to compete amid recent India-Bangladesh cricket tensions following Mustafizur Rahman's Indian Premier League 2026 snub.

Bangladesh Govt Under 'Tremendous Pressure' After KKR Drops Mustafizur Following the Bangladesh government's decision to ban the Indian Premier League (IPL) telecast indefinitely, sports analyst Nikhil Naz provides an in-depth analysis.

Pratika Rawal strongly reacts after her edited photos go viral on social media An account claiming to belong to Indian women's cricketer Pratika Rawal spoke out against unauthorised AI-edited photos circulating on social media platforms. Last year, Pratika was one of India's standout performers at the Women's World Cup held on home soil.

How India's one-eyed Tiger overcame career-ending injury to score 2793 Test runs A serious eye injury threatened to end Mansur Ali Khan Pataudi's career before it began. Instead, he rebuilt his game, overcame profound limitations and went on to become one of Indian cricket's most influential captains.

Shubman Gill comes up with idea to help arrest India's Test cricket slide: Report India's new Test captain Shubman Gill has reportedly proposed dedicated 15-day red-ball camps ahead of every Test series, as the team looks to arrest its slide following back-to-back home series defeats and revive its campaign in the World Test Championship.

Former England captain blasts Jamie Smith's SCG Test dismissal: Worst of this AshesJamie Smith's rash dismissal at the SCG shifted England's momentum on Day 2. Nasser Hussain called it one of the worst shots of this Ashes, highlighting England's ongoing struggle with game awareness.

5th Test: Travis Head 91 follows Joe Root 160 in strong Aussie reply in SydneyAshes 5th Test: Any doubts about Australia's intensity were brushed aside as the hosts came up with an intense bowling show to bowl England out for 384 and then rode on Travis Head's unbeaten 91 off 87 balls to reach 166 for 2 at Stumps on Day 2 in Sydney.

Travis Head first Australian since Steve Smith with 500 runs in an Ashes editionTravis Head ended Australia's seven-year wait in the Ashes with a stellar 528 runs in the 2025 series. His dominant innings in the final Test at SCG kept Australia competitive despite a strong England total.

Bangladesh orders indefinite ban on IPL telecast after Mustafizur Rahman rowThe Bangladesh government has imposed an indefinite ban on the telecast and promotion of the Indian Premier League (IPL) in response to the controversy over the removal of national fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman from the Kolkata Knight Riders squad.

Watch: Rohit's son Ahaan shares adorable moment with Pandya's girlfriendA warm off-field moment involving Mahieka Sharma and Rohit Sharma's son went viral ahead of India's New Zealand ODIs. With the 2026 season beginning, focus also shifts to squad rotation and Rohit's form.

Neeraj Chopra parts ways with JSW Sports, launches his own management firmIndia's Olympic and world champion javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has brought an end to his decade-long association with JSW Sports, opting to take a new step in his career by launching his own athlete management firm, Vel Sports.

World champion India Women eye Australia-like era of dominanceIndia won the Women's World Cup last year in front of a packed house in Navi Mumbai, but there's still a long way to go before they can build a legacy like Australia have since their first World Cup victory in 1978.

Brisbane Heat name out-of-favour Pakistan pacer as Shaheen Afridi replacementBrisbane Heat have drafted in Pakistan pacer Zaman Khan as an injury replacement for Shaheen Shah Afridi, who has returned home after suffering a knee cartilage injury during the Big Bash League.

Mohammed Siraj is unlucky to miss out on T20 World Cup spot: AB de VilliersAB de Villiers believes Mohammed Siraj was unfortunate to miss India's T20 World Cup squad. The former South Africa captain feels balance, not ability, worked against Siraj in a spin-heavy selection approach.

Watch: Pakistan's Naseem Shah trumps Kieron Pollard after heated verbal exchangeILT20 final: Pakistan fast bowler Naseem Shah was engaged in a verbal battle with Kieron Pollard during the big final in Dubai. Naseem's three-wicket haul played a key role in helping Desert Vipers beat MI Emirates and win their maiden ILT20 title on Sunday.

Mustafizur IPL row: Bangladesh teammate reveals how pacer reacted to KKR snubDespite the IPL setback after his KKR release, Mustafizur Rahman has stayed calm and responded emphatically with match-winning performances for Rangpur Riders in the Bangladesh Premier League (BPL) 2026.

Arne Slot backs Liverpool's measured style of play despite Fulham drawArne Slot defended Liverpool's approach after another frustrating draw. Despite questions over creativity and identity, the manager insisted his philosophy remains intact as the Reds continue to search for balance and consistency.

Running with a purpose: Pooja Krishnamurthy flies the Indian flag at Brazil 135Speaking to India Today exclusively, Indian ultrarunner Pooja Krishnamoorthy talks about her journey from the start, her bigger cause with each mile she covers and the challenges at the Brazil 135.

BCCI's Mustafizur Rahman no-ball shows why cricket is not a serious sportAs avoidable as a no-ball, the BCCI's handling of Mustafizur Rahman has pushed Bangladesh to reconsider touring India, further destabilising a sport already weakened by political interference, administrative hesitation and an alarming lack of clear, consistent authority.

Novak Djokovic quits tennis player body he founded in shock exitNovak Djokovic co-founded the PTPA to give players a stronger, independent voice in how the sport is run. Six years on, he has stepped away from the organisation, saying concerns over transparency mean it no longer reflects his values.

Report: Bangladesh Cricket Board Seeks Hybrid Model For T20 World Cup In IndiaIn this transcript, an unidentified speaker discusses the Bangladesh Cricket Board's (BCB) request for a 'hybrid model' for the T20 World Cup. The speaker states that the board is ready to play India but prefers matches to be moved out of the country due to safety concerns for players. The individual mentions that the decision is influenced by government directives and cites the release of a player, likely Mustafizur Rahman, from the IPL franchise Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) for security reasons. The speaker also notes that the team was scheduled to play three games in Kolkata and one in Mumbai.

RR to play in Pune? State board approaches BCCI to retain IPL matches in JaipurRajasthan Cricket Association has stepped in to protect Rajasthan Royals' Jaipur base. With uncertainty over IPL 2026 venues, the RCA has formally urged the BCCI to keep RR home games at Sawai Mansingh Stadium.

Messi vs Ronaldo: Will FIFA World Cup 2026 be the stage for a final GOAT battle?Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo will lock horns once again, this time under the bright lights of the World Cup. With their careers set to come to a close, can the GOATS deliver one final magical performance for Argentina and Portugal respectively?

MS Dhoni is my brother from another mother: Dwayne Bravo opens up on CSK bondDwayne Bravo revealed how MS Dhoni's trust shaped his role at Chennai Super Kings. By keeping things simple and backing his players, Dhoni built an environment that helped CSK succeed consistently in the IPL.

Ruben Amorim's jibe hints at off-field tensions at Manchester United after Leeds drawRuben Amorim's post-match comments overshadowed Manchester United's draw at Leeds. By stressing he is a manager and not just a coach, Amorim publicly exposed growing tension with the club's hierarchy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
